intro: Coccoloba neurophylla, commonly known as the coastal beauty or rock nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal areas, rocky soils, and disturbed habitats. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. It is adapted to saline and wind-prone environments, making it a hardy species in coastal ecosystems. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion.
